name: Person Name
description: The PN data type specifies the names of persons using a six-component structure. This data type was used in earlier versions of HL7 but has been replaced by XPN (Extended Person Name) as of HL7 v2.3. Maintained for backward compatibility with systems using older message formats.

PN.1.name: Family Name
PN.1.description: Surname of a person. If a person's name has only one component, that name is sent in this field, which is common practice in some countries such as Indonesia.

PN.2.name: Given Name
PN.2.description: First name of the person. Also known as the given name or forename.

PN.3.name: Middle Initial or Name
PN.3.description: Middle name or middle initial. Multiple middle names may be included.

PN.4.name: Suffix
PN.4.description: Name suffix (e.g., JR or III). Used for generational suffixes and other name extensions.

PN.5.name: Prefix
PN.5.description: Name prefix or title (e.g., DR). Professional and courtesy titles that precede the name.

PN.6.name: Degree
PN.6.description: Academic or professional degree (e.g., MD). Educational qualifications and professional designations.

constraints.singleName: If person has only one name component, send in PN.1 (Family Name)
constraints.characterSets: Supports multiple character sets for international usage

usage: Patient names in earlier HL7 versions (replaced by XPN)

Person names in systems that haven't migrated to XPN

generationHints.typical: Use realistic names appropriate for healthcare demographics
generationHints.migration: Consider using XPN for new implementations

internationalSupport.description: Supports multiple character sets for international usage
internationalSupport.characterSets: Can switch between alphabetic, ideographic, and phonetic character sets
internationalSupport.singleNameCountries: Some countries like Indonesia commonly use single names in the Family Name field

validationRules.familyNameRequired: PN.1 (Family Name) should always be populated
validationRules.characterSetHandling: Follow HL7 character set switching rules for international names

replacement.successor: XPN (Extended Person Name) replaces PN as of HL7 v2.3
replacement.migration: New implementations should use XPN for enhanced name support
replacement.compatibility: PN maintained for backward compatibility with older systems
replacement.enhancement: XPN provides additional components like name type and representation codes

deprecationNotes.status: Replaced by XPN as of HL7 v2.3
deprecationNotes.supportReason: Maintained for backward compatibility with legacy systems
deprecationNotes.migrationPath: Direct mapping from PN components to corresponding XPN components
